title: Keen 1 Level Competition!
content:
(I hope to invent a better name later!)

So, here's the deal! This is an idea I've got some time ago, and finally got around launching this competition.. So here it is:

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] Keen 1 Level Competition [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img]

The competition will close on 1st January 2007. Before that the entries should be sent to me via e-mail to keenrush [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] keengrid [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] net.

After that I'll make a level pack of the entries and post it somewhere here in the forums. Then I'll make a topic about the voting -- but more about that once it's its time.

It's forbidden to upload or post levels anywhere before the level pack is released. And, the levels need to be new ones, especially made for this competition. Only one level per Keener.

The point is to make an old-school, as well as you can, Keen 1 level. The player should be able to complete the level mainly without using the pogo stick (but there may be one or two jumps that require him to pogo) -- but in such case the player may not get all the candy available. Using the collectiable Bean-with-Bacon parts in the level is forbidden. Try to have Keen 1 spirit in the level! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rasta.gif[/img]
Don't use any tile in your level that wasn't used in the original Keen 1 levels -- that meaning, don't use the world map tiles in your level, for example.

Keen will start each level with zero ammo and without the pogo!

Any questions? Good luck, and have fun! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Level Competition!
content: This is neat.

title: Re: Level Competition!
content:
Finally, 'tis launched. I'm in.

Did you decide if we're hiding the pogo somewhere in each level? Or is there going to be a dedicated pogo level?

title: Re: Level Competition!
content:
Glad you guys like the idea. Can't wait for the level pack already, hehe. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img]

Spleen: Each level starts without pogo, but it isn't required that there is one, in case the player can complete the whole level without pogo. (The levels should be possible to play through almost entirely without using pogo, however. Like in Keen 1.)3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

content:
Great! Nice to see people have interest in this. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

The difficulty level -- well, it's your decision, but it shouldn't be far from the most difficult level in Keen 1 (whatever that is), as Keen1ishness is what we're searching here for. So, nothing extreme (so, don't look at my XkyKeen1 level pack!).3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"

title: Let me in!
content: I'm new and would really like to join, but could someone show me a good level editor, thanks. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Let me in!
content:
[url=http://dosclassics.com/download/190]dosclassics.com/download/190[/url][url=http://dosclassics.com/download/190]KeenWright[/url] is pretty much the only truly good, stable level editor out there (so far).There's two versions that come with it, a DOS version, and a Windows version. Neither of them are completely finished, so there's some missing features. But everything you need is there.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: I'm good now!
content:
thanks for that.

EDIT: when i start it it asks me for keen bitmaps but i go into where keen1 is and it shows nothing, what do i do.

EDIT2: Okay i got it working now, but how do i play the levels.

title: Re: I'm good now!
content: Name your completed level something like LEVEL01.CK1 and drop it into the Keen 1 folder. It will then replace the existing level, and will appear when you enter the point on the world map that the previous level occupied.

title: Re: I'm good now!
content: Oh okay thanks i'll try it

title: Re: I'm good now!
content:
Seems like this is inspiring a lot of new people to make Keen levels. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
Anyway, I sent my level. It only took about an hour and a half (split over two days), and it's pretty big. So if anyone is saying that they don't have enough time, think again!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] -Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]
